p: Moringa oleifera plays an important role in protecting the liver from damage, oxidation and toxicity due to the high concentrations of polyphenols in its leaves and flowers. Moringa oleifera oil can also restore liver enzymes to normal levels, reducing oxidative stress and increasing protein content in the liver. The flowers and roots of the Moringa oleifera plant contain a compound called quercetin, which is known to protect the liver [ 78]. Other compounds contained in the plant with this activity are Î²-sitosterol, quercetin and some of its glycosides, rutin [ 61, 75] and flavonoids, which also prevent lipid oxidation [ 79].
